t: Jeremiah 50
Prophecy against Babylon
The*p word which the Lord*s spoke concerning Babylon, the land of the Chaldeans, through Jeremiah the prophet:

“Declare*pn and proclaim among the nations. Proclaim*ln it and lift up a standard. Do*ln not conceal it*i but*i say, ‘Babylon*ln has been captured, Bel*ln has been put to shame, Marduk has been shattered; Her*ln images have been put to shame, her idols have been shattered.’
For*p a nation has come up against her out of the north; it will make her land an object of horror, and there will be no inhabitant in it. Both man and beast have wandered off, they have gone away!

“In*p those days and at that time,” declares the Lord,*s “the sons of Israel will come, both*i they and the sons of Judah as well; they will go along weeping as they go, and it will be the Lord*s their God they will seek.
They will ask for the way to Zion, turning*i their faces in its direction; they will come that they may join themselves to the Lord*s in*i an everlasting covenant that will not be forgotten.

“My*pn people have become lost sheep; Their*ln shepherds have led them astray. They*ln have made them turn aside on*i the mountains; They*ln have gone along from mountain to hill And*ln have forgotten their resting place.

All*ln who came upon them have devoured them; And*ln their adversaries have said, ‘We are not guilty, Inasmuch*ln as they have sinned against the Lord*s who*i is*i the habitation of righteousness, Even*ln the Lord,*s the hope of their fathers.’
“Wander*ln away from the midst of Babylon And*ln go forth from the land of the Chaldeans; Be*ln also like male goats at the head of the flock.

For*ln behold, I am going to arouse and bring up against Babylon A*ln horde of great nations from the land of the north, And*ln they will draw up their*i battle lines against her; From*ln there she will be taken captive. Their*ln arrows will be like an expert warrior Who*ln does not return empty-handed.
Chaldea*ln will become plunder; All*ln who plunder her will have enough,” declares the Lord.*s
“Because*ln you are glad, because you are jubilant, O*ln you who pillage My heritage, Because*ln you skip about like a threshing heifer And*ln neigh like stallions,
Your*ln mother will be greatly ashamed, She*ln who gave you birth will be humiliated. Behold,*ln she*i will*i be*i the least of the nations, A*ln wilderness, a parched land and a desert.

Because*ln of the indignation of the Lord*s she will not be inhabited, But*ln she will be completely desolate; Everyone*ln who passes by Babylon will be horrified And*ln will hiss because of all her wounds.
Draw*ln up your battle lines against Babylon on every side, All*ln you who bend the bow; Shoot*ln at her, do not be sparing with your*i arrows, For*ln she has sinned against the Lord.*s

Raise*ln your battle cry against her on every side! She*ln has given herself up, her pillars have fallen, Her*ln walls have been torn down. For*ln this is the vengeance of the Lord:*s Take*ln vengeance on her; As*ln she has done to*i others,*i so*i do to her.

Cut*ln off the sower from Babylon And*ln the one who wields the sickle at the time of harvest; From*ln before the sword of the oppressor They*ln will each turn back to his own people And*ln they will each flee to his own land.

“Israel*p is a scattered flock, the lions have driven them*i away. The first one who*i devoured him was the king of Assyria, and this last one who*i has broken his bones is Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
Therefore thus says the Lord*s of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Behold, I am going to punish the king of Babylon and his land, just as I punished the king of Assyria.
And I will bring Israel back to his pasture and he will graze on Carmel and Bashan, and his desire will be satisfied in the hill country of Ephraim and Gilead.

In those days and at that time,’ declares the Lord,*s ‘search will be made for the iniquity of Israel, but there will be none; and for the sins of Judah, but they will not be found; for I will pardon those whom I leave as a remnant.’

“Against*pn the land of Merathaim, go up against it, And*ln against the inhabitants of Pekod. Slay*ln and utterly destroy them,” declares the Lord,*s “And*ln do according to all that I have commanded you.
The*ln noise of battle is in the land, And*ln great destruction.
How*ln the hammer of the whole earth Has*ln been cut off and broken! How*ln Babylon has become An*ln object of horror among the nations!
I*ln set a snare for you and you were also caught, O Babylon, While*ln you yourself were not aware; You*ln have been found and also seized Because*ln you have engaged in conflict with the Lord.”*s
The*ln Lord*s has opened His armory And*ln has brought forth the weapons of His indignation, For*ln it is a work of the Lord God*s of hosts In*ln the land of the Chaldeans.
Come*ln to her from the farthest border; Open*ln up her barns, Pile*ln her up like heaps And*ln utterly destroy her, Let*ln nothing be left to her.
Put*ln all her young bulls to the sword; Let*ln them go down to the slaughter! Woe*ln be upon them, for their day has come, The*ln time of their punishment.
There*ln is a sound of fugitives and refugees from the land of Babylon, To*ln declare in Zion the vengeance of the Lord*s our God, Vengeance*ln for His temple.

“Summon*ln many against Babylon, All*ln those who bend the bow: Encamp*ln against her on every side, Let*ln there be no escape. Repay*ln her according to her work; According*ln to all that she has done, so*i do to her; For*ln she has become arrogant against the Lord,*s Against*ln the Holy One of Israel.
Therefore*ln her young men will fall in her streets, And*ln all her men of war will be silenced in that day,” declares the Lord.*s
“Behold,*ln I am against you, O arrogant one,” Declares*ln the Lord God*s of hosts, “For*ln your day has come, The*ln time when I will punish you.
The*ln arrogant one will stumble and fall With*ln no one to raise him up; And*ln I will set fire to his cities And*ln it will devour all his environs.”
Thus*ln says the Lord*s of hosts, “The*ln sons of Israel are oppressed, And*ln the sons of Judah as well; And*ln all who took them captive have held them fast, They*ln have refused to let them go.
Their*ln Redeemer is strong, the Lord*s of hosts is His name; He*ln will vigorously plead their case So*ln that He may bring rest to the earth, But*ln turmoil to the inhabitants of Babylon.
A*ln sword against the Chaldeans,” declares the Lord,*s “And*ln against the inhabitants of Babylon And*ln against her officials and her wise men!
A*ln sword against the oracle priests, and they will become fools! A*ln sword against her mighty men, and they will be shattered!

A*ln sword against their horses and against their chariots And*ln against all the foreigners who are in the midst of her, And*ln they will become women! A*ln sword against her treasures, and they will be plundered!
A*ln drought on her waters, and they will be dried up! For*ln it is a land of idols, And*ln they are mad over fearsome idols.

“Therefore*ln the desert creatures will live there*i along with the jackals; The*ln ostriches also will live in it, And*ln it will never again be inhabited Or*ln dwelt in from generation to generation.
As*ln when God overthrew Sodom And*ln Gomorrah with its neighbors,” declares the Lord,*s “No*ln man will live there, Nor*ln will any*i son of man reside in it.
“Behold,*ln a people is coming from the north, And*ln a great nation and many kings Will*ln be aroused from the remote parts of the earth.

They*ln seize their*i bow and javelin; They*ln are cruel and have no mercy. Their*ln voice roars like the sea; And*ln they ride on horses, Marshalled*ln like a man for the battle Against*ln you, O daughter of Babylon.
The*ln king of Babylon has heard the report about them, And*ln his hands hang limp; Distress*ln has gripped him, Agony*ln like a woman in childbirth.

“Behold,*p one will come up like a lion from the thicket of the Jordan to a perennially watered pasture; for in an instant I will make them run away from it, and whoever is chosen I will appoint over it. For who is like Me, and who will summon Me into*i court?*i And who then is the shepherd who can stand before Me?”

Therefore hear the plan of the Lord*s which He has planned against Babylon, and His purposes which He has purposed against the land of the Chaldeans: surely they will drag them off, even*i the little ones of the flock; surely He will make their pasture desolate because of them.
At the shout, “Babylon has been seized!” the earth is shaken, and an outcry is heard among the nations.
